intro: Calytrix microcoma, commonly known as the small-flowered calytrix, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is often found in sandy soils. It has small, narrow leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous small seeds. Calytrix microcoma is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
